meanings.sent1: The downthrows of the ball were swift and precise.
meanings.sent2: The mountain climber experienced a sudden downthrows as he slipped on the icy slope.
meanings.sent3: The downthrows of the waterfall created a mesmerizing sight for the tourists.
meanings.sent4: The downthrows of the stock market left investors in a state of panic.
meanings.sent5: The downthrows of the hammer echoed through the workshop.

meanings.definition: The act of overthrowing or bringing down.
meanings.sent1: The rebels planned a series of downthrows to overthrow the oppressive regime.
meanings.sent2: The downthrows of the corrupt government were met with cheers from the citizens.
meanings.sent3: The downthrows of the cake at the party symbolized the end of the celebration.
meanings.sent4: The downthrows of the chess pieces marked the defeat of the reigning champion.
meanings.sent5: The downthrows of the old building revealed hidden treasures buried beneath.
